snippet: For the first time since 2009, the number of short-term unemployed workers has surpassed the number of long-term unemployed workers — a sign of demand in the job market.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column notes long-term unemployment rate has fallen below short-term rate for first time in five years; says government figures indicate people are quitting in greater numbers and that more unfilled jobs are available.
lead_paragraph: For the first time since 2009, the number of short-term unemployed workers has surpassed the number of long-term unemployed workers — a sign of demand in the job market.

headline.print_headline: A Handful of Indicators Showing Growth on the Jobs Front
headline.main: Indications of Growth in U.S. Job Market
